AR12XX Radar Sensor API
External Device Interface API

 Maximum number of cascaded AR12xx supported.

 Maximum length of the string to identify the radar sensor.

 Sensor Name for the AR1243 Radar Sensor.

  BSP_AR12XX_CONFIG_CHANNEL = 0x1U, BSP_AR12XX_CONFIG_ADC_OUT = 0x2U, BSP_AR12XX_CONFIG_DATA_FORMAT = 0x4U, BSP_AR12XX_CONFIG_LOW_POWER_MODE = 0x8U,

  BSP_AR12XX_CONFIG_ALL = 0xFFFFU, BSP_AR12XX_CONFIG_CONT_STREAMING = 0x10000U
}

Detailed Description

This modules define API specific to AR12XX Radar Sensor.

Typedef Documentation

typedef void(* Bsp_Ar12xxMonAppCb) (UInt16 sbId, void *payload)

Monitorring call back function. The two params are.

Parameters
sbIdSub Block ID of the monitorring message
payloadPayload of the monitorring message. Has the monitorring report that the application can see.
Returns
none

Enumeration Type Documentation

enum Bsp_Ar12xxConfigOption

Enumeration to define which configurations need to written or over-written by the Bsp_ar12xxConfigParams API.

Enumerator
BSP_AR12XX_CONFIG_CHANNEL 

Bit map to re-config/config channel configuration

BSP_AR12XX_CONFIG_ADC_OUT 

Bit map to re-config/config ADC output configuration

BSP_AR12XX_CONFIG_DATA_FORMAT 

Bit map to re-config/config Data format configuration

BSP_AR12XX_CONFIG_LOW_POWER_MODE 

Bit map to re-config/config Low power mode configuration

BSP_AR12XX_CONFIG_RF_INIT_CAL_MASK 

Bit map to configure the RF Calibration

BSP_AR12XX_CONFIG_RF_INIT 

Bit map to perform RF initialization

BSP_AR12XX_CONFIG_DATA_PATH 

Bit map to re-config/config data path configuration

BSP_AR12XX_CONFIG_LVDS_CLK 

Bit map to re-config/config LVDS clock configuration

BSP_AR12XX_CONFIG_HSI_CLK 

Bit map to re-config/config HSI clock configuration

BSP_AR12XX_CONFIG_PROFILE_PARAM 

Bit map to re-config/config profile configuration

BSP_AR12XX_CONFIG_CHIRP_PARAM 

Bit map to re-config/config chirp configuration

BSP_AR12XX_CONFIG_BPM_COMMON 

Bit map to re-config/config BPM common configuration

BSP_AR12XX_CONFIG_BPM_CHIRP 

Bit map to re-config/config BPM chirp configuration

BSP_AR12XX_CONFIG_CSI_LANES 

Bit map to re-config/config CSI lane positions and polarity

BSP_AR12XX_CONFIG_LDO_BYPASS 

Bit map to re-config/config LDO Bypass

BSP_AR12XX_CONFIG_FRAME_PARAM 

Bit map to re-config/config frame configuration

BSP_AR12XX_CONFIG_ALL 

Bit map to re-config/config all configurations for Frame config.

BSP_AR12XX_CONFIG_CONT_STREAMING 

Bit map to configure and enable continuous streaming.

enum Bsp_AR12xxConnType

Enumeration to define AR12xx connection types.

Enumerator
BSP_AR12XX_CONN_TYPE_UNKNOWN 

Unknown Connection Type

BSP_AR12XX_CONN_TYPE_DIRECT 

AR12xx Direct Connection

BSP_AR12XX_CONN_TYPE_FPDLINK 

AR12xx Connected via FPD-Link

BSP_AR12XX_CONN_TYPE_COUNT 

Count of AR12xx connection types

enum Bsp_Ar12xxFrameType

Enumeration to define AR12xx Frame types.

Enumerator
BSP_AR12XX_FRAME_TYPE_NORMAL 

Normal Frame

BSP_AR12XX_FRAME_TYPE_ADVANCED 

Advanced Frame

enum Bsp_Ar12xxGpioInputPins

Enumeration to define all the input pins to the host device.

Enumerator
BSP_AR12XX_GPIO_INPUT_HOST_INTR 

GPIO Host interrupt Pin details

BSP_AR12XX_GPIO_INPUT_COUNT 

Count of the GPIO input pins

enum Bsp_Ar12xxGpioOutputPins

Enumeration to define all the output pins from the host device.

Enumerator
BSP_AR12XX_GPIO_OUTPUT_NRESET 

GPIO control for nreset output

BSP_AR12XX_GPIO_OUTPUT_WARM_RESET 

GPIO control for warm reset output

BSP_AR12XX_GPIO_OUTPUT_NERRORIN 

GPIO control for Error input pin to the AR12XX

BSP_AR12XX_GPIO_OUTPUT_SOP_MODE_SEL_TDO 

SOP mode selection for TDO

BSP_AR12XX_GPIO_OUTPUT_SOP_MODE_SEL_SYNCOUT 

SOP mode selection for synchronization

BSP_AR12XX_GPIO_OUTPUT_SOP_MODE_SEL_PMICOUT 

SOP mode selection for PMIC output

BSP_AR12XX_GPIO_OUTPUT_UART_SELECTA 

UART device Selection GPIO Control

BSP_AR12XX_GPIO_OUTPUT_UART_SELECTB 

UART device Selection GPIO Control

BSP_AR12XX_GPIO_OUTPUT_COUNT 

Count of the GPIO output pins

Function Documentation

Int32 Bsp_ar12xxBoot ( UInt32  downloadFirmware)

AR12XX radar sensor boot function.

Switches on the AR12xx sensor and ensures the firmware has finished the initialization sequence.

Parameters
downloadFirmwareFlag used to indicate whether to load the firmware via SPI. If the AR12 flash is pre-flashed or programmed via Bsp_ar12xxFlashFirmware, then this flag can be 0 i.e. Do not load firmware via SPI. when 1, the API will try to download the firmware via SPI.
Returns
BSP_SOK on success else appropriate BSP error code on failure.
Int32 Bsp_ar12xxConfigMonitor ( UInt32  deviceId,
Bsp_Ar12xxMonConfigObj *  sensorMonCfg 
)

Function to config monitoring within the AWR sensor.

Parameters
deviceIdDevice Index for which to set the monitoring configuration. Can be 0/1/2/3...
sensorMonCfgPointer to monitoring configuration Structure.
Returns
retVal If any monitoring config API fail it return Error code without invoking further APIs
Int32 Bsp_ar12xxConfigParams ( UInt32  bitMapEnableConfig)

Function to configure the different parameters of the radar sensor.

Parameters
bitMapEnableConfigBit map index which defines which parameters need to be configured. Refer Bsp_Ar12xxConfigOption to get the bit map.
Returns
retVal Returns BSP_SOK if the driver parameters are configured correctly. BSP_EFAIL is returned otherwise.
Int32 Bsp_ar12xxDeInit ( void  )

AR12XX radar sensor driver deinit function.

Uninitializes the AR12XX driver and deletes the McSPI driver and should be called during system shutdown. Should not be called if Bsp_ar12xxInit() is not called.

Returns
BSP_SOK on success, else appropriate BSP error code on failure.
Int32 Bsp_ar12xxEnableDummySource ( UInt32  deviceId,
Bsp_Ar12xxTestSource *  testSource 
)

Function to set some dummy objects that the AR12xx can give to the host CPU. This enables testing of the algorithm.

Parameters
deviceIdDevice Index for which to set the test source.
testSourceContains the parameters corresponding to the dummy objects.
Returns
retVal Returns BSP_SOK if the dummy objects parameters are set correctly. BSP_EFAIL otherwise.
Int32 Bsp_ar12xxEraseFirmware ( void  )

Function to erase the flash associated with the AR12xx for storing the firmware.

Returns
retVal Returns BSP_SOK if the AR12xx Flash is successfully erased. BSP_EFAIL otherwise.
Int32 Bsp_ar12xxFlashFirmware ( void  )

Function to program the flash associated with the AR12xx with the firmware which is part of the mmwavedfp package. This API should always be called after Bsp_ar12xxEraseFirmware.

Returns
retVal Returns BSP_SOK if the AR12xx Flash is successfully flashed. BSP_EFAIL otherwise.
Int32 Bsp_ar12xxGetConfiguredParam ( UInt32  deviceOfInterest,
UInt32  paramOfInterest,
UInt32  index,
void *  ptr 
)

Function to configure the different parameters of the radar sensor.

Parameters
deviceOfInterestDevice Index of interest (0/1/2/3)
paramOfInterestBit map index which defines which parameter need to be read back. Refer Bsp_Ar12xxConfigOption. Valid option includes: BSP_AR12XX_CONFIG_PROFILE_PARAM BSP_AR12XX_CONFIG_CHIRP_PARAM BSP_AR12XX_CONFIG_FRAME_PARAM Unlike the set param, call this API with only one option.
indexFor profile config and chirp config this defines which index is read. For frame config this field is ignored.
ptrPointer to the object to which the parameter values is returned. The following types of parameter pointers should be passed: BSP_AR12XX_CONFIG_PROFILE_PARAM - rlProfileCfg_t * BSP_AR12XX_CONFIG_CHIRP_PARAM - rlChirpCfg_t * BSP_AR12XX_CONFIG_FRAME_PARAM - rlFrameCfg_t *
Returns
retVal Returns BSP_SOK if the driver parameters are read correctly. BSP_EFAIL is returned otherwise.
Bsp_AR12xxConnType Bsp_ar12xxGetConnType ( void  )

Function to get the connection type of AR12.

Returns
retVal Returns Bsp_AR12xxConnType.
Int32 Bsp_ar12xxGetTemperature ( UInt32  deviceId,
rlRfTempData_t *  readTempData 
)

Function to read back device temperature.

Parameters
deviceIdDevice ID for which the temperature should be read. Can take the values 0/1/2/3
readTempDataThis parameter is populated with the temperature value read back from the radar sensor.
Returns
retVal Returns BSP_SOK if the temperature is read correctly
Int32 Bsp_ar12xxGetWidthHeight ( UInt32  deviceId,
UInt32 *  width,
UInt32 *  height 
)

Function to get the width and height of the radar frame based on the configuration for the radar requested. This function should be called only after Bsp_ar12xxInit.

Parameters
deviceIdDevice Index for which to get the width & height.
widthWidth of the radar frame.
heightHeight of the radar frame.
Returns
retVal Returns BSP_SOK if the width and height parameters are received correctly. BSP_EFAIL otherwise.
Int32 Bsp_ar12xxInit ( const Bsp_Ar12xxInitParams *  initPrms)

AR12XX radar sensor driver init function.

Initializes the AR12XX driver. This function should be called before calling any of sensor APIs and should be called only once.

Parameters
initPrmsPointer to the init parameter containing instance specific information
Returns
BSP_SOK on success else appropriate BSP error code on failure.
static void Bsp_ar12xxInitParams_init ( Bsp_Ar12xxInitParams *  initPrms)
inlinestatic

Bsp_Ar12xxInitParams structure init function.

Parameters
initPrmsPointer to Bsp_Ar12xxInitParams structure.
Int32 Bsp_ar12xxReconfigChirp ( UInt32  deviceId,
rlDynChirpCfg_t *  dynChirpData,
UInt32  numChirpSeg 
)

Function to reconfigure chirps dynamically.

Parameters
deviceIdDevice ID for which the temperature should be read. Can take the values 0/1/2/3...
dynChirpDataNew chirp configuration data.
numChirpSegNumber of chirps to configure.
Returns
retVal Returns BSP_SOK if the chirps are set correctly.
Int32 Bsp_ar12xxRegisterConfig ( char  name[BSP_AR12XX_MAX_SENSOR_NAME_LENGTH],
Bsp_Ar12xxConfigObj *  configObj 
)

AR12XX radar sensor register configuration function.

Parameters
nameName of the Radar Sensor confgiuration to be registered. One should ensure to provide the same name in initPrms of Bsp_ar12xxInit function.
configObjPointer to the radar configuration parameters asctime defined by Bsp_Ar12xxConfigObj.
Returns
BSP_SOK on success else appropriate BSP error code on failure.
Int32 Bsp_ar12xxRestoreCalibData ( UInt32  deviceId,
rlCalibrationData_t *  calibDataStoreRestore 
)

Function to reconfigure calibration data.

Parameters
deviceIdDevice ID for which the temperature should be read. Can take the values 0/1/2/3...
calibDataStoreRestoreCalibration Data.
Returns
retVal Returns BSP_SOK if the calibration is restored correctly.
Int32 Bsp_ar12xxSetTestSourceSeeds ( void  )

Function to set seeds for the test source. This makes the test source data pattern constant.

Returns
retVal Returns BSP_SOK if the seeds are set correctly
Int32 Bsp_ar12xxStartRadar ( void  )

AR12XX radar sensor driver start function. This function will start the radar sensor operation.

Returns
BSP_SOK on success else appropriate BSP error code on failure.
Int32 Bsp_ar12xxStartTestPattern ( rltestPattern_t *  testPatternCfg)

Function to Start the transmission of the test pattern as specified in the testPatternCfg.

Parameters
testPatternCfgThe configuration for the test pattern.
Returns
retVal Returns BSP_SOK if test pattern configuration is successful.
Int32 Bsp_ar12xxStopRadar ( void  )

AR12XX radar sensor driver stop function. This function will stop the radar sensor operation and power it off.

Returns
BSP_SOK on success else appropriate BSP error code on failure.
Int32 Bsp_ar12xxSwitchConfig ( UInt32  deviceId,
char  configName[BSP_AR12XX_MAX_SENSOR_NAME_LENGTH] 
)

Function to switch to a given configuration. This is an optional step if the only a single AR1243 configuration is used. If there are more than one configurations used then one can use the following API to switch between configurations after performing Bsp_ar12xxInit.

Parameters
deviceIdDevice Index for which to switch Configuration.
configNameName of the configuration.
Returns
retVal Returns BSP_SOK if the configuration is successfully switched. BSP_EFAIL otherwise.
Int32 Bsp_ar12xxUnRegisterConfig ( char  configName[BSP_AR12XX_MAX_SENSOR_NAME_LENGTH])

Function to unregister a given configuration.

Parameters
configNameName of the configuration.
Returns
retVal Returns BSP_SOK if the configuration is successfully removed. BSP_EFAIL otherwise.
